info.description:
API contains operations on Aladdin User resource.

# Description

An Aladdin User is a person or a system account that can login into
 Aladdin client's website and may be granted access to Aladdin applications.

## Example Use Cases

 This API may be used to:
  - create records of Aladdin Client's employees
  - retrieve information about
    = Aladdin Client's employees granted access to Aladdin
    = BlackRock employees granted access to client's Aladdin products
    = bot accounts granted access to Aladdin
  - modify Aladdin Client's employees records in Aladdin system
  - search User records by email or client's internal user id (if populated)

## Implementation Status

This API is production ready. In the future it will be enhanced with additional search capabilities

  [Developer Guide]: apps/aladdin-developer-portal/#/guides/developer-guide
info.title: Aladdin User

get.description:
Returns fully populated records for all users with active 
status (not terminated). The records are sorted by Aladdin login id.
Not more than one full page of records is returned at one time.

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description:
The maximum number of Users to return. The service may
return fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most 100
Users will be returned per page. The maximum value is 100; values
above 100 will be coerced to 100.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description:
A page token, received from a previous 'ListUsers' call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to
'ListUsers' must match the call that provided the page
token.
parameters.name: pageToken

get.summary: Searches a user, exact match will be returned

parameters.description: A unique identifier for this request.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Request-ID

parameters.description: Timestamp assigned to this request at origin, in "HTTP-date" format as defined by RFC 7231.
parameters.name: VND.com.blackrock.Origin-Timestamp

parameters.description:
Email id. If any other field is provided along with email, then search
would be performed by email only.
parameters.name: email

parameters.description:
Key of alternate id, Eg : clientUserId. Both key & value should be
provided.
parameters.name: alternateId.alternateIdKey

parameters.description: Value of alternate id, Eg : employeeNumber123. Both key & value should be provided.
parameters.name: alternateId.alternateIdValue

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

UserUserProfile.title: User profile  - properties that might affect access decisions?

initials.title:
User's initials
(-- api-linter: core::0144::message-field-plural=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: initials is a singular --)

department.description:
User's department
Department is internally mapped into roles. The AM_ROLE_MAP decode contains further role mapping data.

clientAbbreviation.description:
User's primary client abbreviation: the client where the user is
employed.

UserUserRecordStatus.title:
User record status, tells which parts of the record are complete, and which
are missing

complete.title: Boolean flag telling if user information is complete

presentParts.title: Parts of the user record that are complete

missingParts.title: Parts of the user record that are not complete

missingOptionalParts.title: Parts of the user record that are optional

enumsUserType.description:
- USER_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Reserved value
 - USER_TYPE_CLIENT_EMPLOYEE: A User who is an employee of this client
 - USER_TYPE_PROVIDER: A User who is an employee of a AladdinProvider
 - USER_TYPE_SYSTEM: System User
 - USER_TYPE_BLK_EMPLOYEE: A User who is a BlackRock employee
enumsUserType.title: Enumeration of possible Aladdin User classications

alternateIdKey.title:
Key of alternate id, Eg : clientUserId. Both key & value should be
provided

alternateIdValue.title: Value of alternate id, Eg : employeeNumber123. Both key & value should be provided

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as 'page_token' to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

v1User.title:
User describes a personal or system account that may be granted access to
Aladdin and its products

id.description:
Resources must have a 'id' field.

Id describes the computer or human assigned resource identifier.
Login Id

alternativeUserIds.description:
A map of alternative user identifiers, may contain unique user identifiers
per different systems of records.
At the time only "clientUserId" key is supported for external clients.
The "clientUserId" is used to store client organization's internal user id. One of the common
uses for such an id is to specify the value of the "subject" in SAML SSO assertions.

userType.description:
A read-only type that classifies the User resource. 
If provided when creating or updating a user, any value other than
USER_TYPE_CLIENT_EMPLOYEE will result in an error.

profile.title: Profile attributes. Will only be present for a PERSON user

startDate.title:
User status-related attributes
The date user was activated as Aladdin user

terminationDate.description: The date user was deactivated as Aladdin user.

lastLoginDate.title: The date of user's last login into Aladdin

locked.description: Boolean flag telling whether the user is locked.

active.description: Boolean flag telling whether the user's account is active.

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
scopes.platform.identity.user.v1.User: This grants access to all endpoints in the platform.identity.user.v1.User API

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
scopes.platform.identity.user.v1.User: This grants access to all endpoints in the platform.identity.user.v1.User API
